articles.title: Gift to Kim Jong Il from Chinese organizations
articles.content:
Gift to Kim Jong Il from Chinese organizations 
    Pyongyang, February 10 (KCNA) -- The China association for international friendly contact and the Beijing association for international friendly contact presented a gift to leader Kim Jong Il in their joint name.
 Vice-president of the China association for international friendly contact Li Zhangshun conveyed the gift and the certificate to the DPRK ambassador to China on Feb. 8.

articles.title: February holiday celebrated abroad
DPRK's achievements praised
articles.content:
DPRK's achievements praised
    Pyongyang, February 10 (KCNA) -- Jean-Michel Baylet, president of the Radical Party of Left of France, on Feb. 7 met with a delegation of the Workers' Party of Korea led by Ji Jae Ryong, vice department director of its central committee, on a visit to France.
 On the occasion the president highly praised the achievements made by the workers' party and people of Korea in their efforts to improve the inter-Korean relations and reunify the country in a peaceful way under the wise guidance of leader Kim Jong Il.    
 He said the Radical Party of Left of France expresses belief that the WPK which is making a positive contribution to defending the world peace and security will play a bigger role in the international arena in the future, too. He said he would strive for the development of friendly relations between France and the DPRK.

articles.title: Friendship meeting with Chinese guests
So Jun Sik sentenced to prison term
Tanzanian national seminar held
articles.content:
Tanzanian national seminar held
    Pyongyang, February 10 (KCNA) -- The Seoul district court on Feb. 6 sentenced So Jun Sik, representative of the society for human rights movement, to one year in prison and two years of stay of execution on charges of the violation of the "law on supervision for public peace", Yonhap News reported.
 The court passed such a judgement on him for the mere reason that he did not report his activities to a detective in charge of him though he was under the supervision for public peace for screening his film at a human rights film festival held several years ago.

articles.title: All-out strike called for in S. Korea
Greetings to Iranian President
articles.content:
Greetings to Iranian President
    Pyongyang, February 10 (KCNA) -- The Dae Woo Motor Co. Trade Union of South Korea threatened to go on a all-out strike from Feb. 12, Seoul-based radio no. 1 reported.
 The chairman of the trade union at a rally of unionists held in Puphyong, Inchon, on Feb. 7 declared that it would stage a general strike at worksites and factories across South Korea in protest against the layoff and the company side's restructuring scheduled for Feb. 16.
